page.title: 08TRANSPORT
page.content: {Bus sevices run through Denwick every {2 hours}and most villagers find this adequate, but some would like an hourly service to Alnwick.Almost all have{the use of a car and this is {generally regarded as a necessity {rather than a luxury.}Although Mrs. Dixon remembers most villagers having a bike or a 'bone-shaker'the{roads are {very busy now and dangerous for {cyclists.}The children have B.M.X.s which they ride in the fields.The road which cuts the village in two is very busy and has{no speed restriction.}In a period of about three quarters of an hour over 400 vehicles passed through the village;most were cars travelling quickly and only slowing down for the bend,78 were lorries or large vans and there were 13 slow moving farm vehicles.{It is surprising that there {are very few accidents.
